SEARCH

Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the game board in Jungle King. The board is a 9x7 grid with terrain and pieces.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructor for the Board class. Initializes the grid and terrain of the board.

  • Method Details

    • setupTerrain

      public void setupTerrain()
      Initializes the terrain of the board. Adds lakes, traps, and bases to the terrain.

    • setLakeArea

      public void setLakeArea(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol)
      Marks a section of the board as a lake.
      Parameters:
      startRow - The Starting row of the lake.
      startCol - The Starting column of the lake.
      endRow - The Ending row of the lake.
      endCol - The Ending column of the lake.

    • setTrap

      public void setTrap(int startRow, int startCol, int endRow, int endCol)
      Marks the surrounding spaces of the base as a trap.
      Parameters:
      startRow - The Starting row of the trap.
      startCol - The Starting column of the trap.
      endRow - The Ending row of the trap.
      endCol - The Ending column of the trap.

    • showPossiblePositions

      public void showPossiblePositions(ArrayList<int[]> p1, ArrayList<int[]> p2)
      Displays the board with the possible positions of the pieces.
      Parameters:
      p1 - The possible positions of Player 1's pieces.
      p2 - The possible positions of Player 2's pieces.

    • markPositions

      public void markPositions(char[][] display, ArrayList<int[]> positions)
      Marks the possible positions on the board.
      Parameters:
      display - The board display.
      positions - The possible positions to mark.

    • placePiece

      public void placePiece(Piece piece, int x, int y)
      Places a piece on the board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to place on the board.
      x - The row position to place the piece.
      y - The column position to place the piece.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(int x, int y, Player player)
      Checks if the move is valid.
      Parameters:
      x - The row position to move to.
      y - The column position to move to.
      player - The player making the move.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • updatePiecePosition

      public void updatePiecePosition(Piece piece, int x, int y)
      Updates the position of the piece on the board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to update the position of.
      x - The new row position of the piece.
      y - The new column position of the piece.

    • removePiece

      public void removePiece(Piece piece)
      Removes a piece from the board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to remove from the board.

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Displays the current state of the board.

      Gets the piece at the specified position.
      Parameters:

      y - The column position of the piece.
      Returns:
      The piece at the specified position.

    • getTerrain

      public char getTerrain(int x, int y)
      Gets the terrain at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      x - The row position of the terrain.
      y - The column position of the terrain.
      Returns:
      The terrain at the specified position.

    • isLake

      public boolean isLake(int x, int y)
      Checks if the specified position is a lake.
      Parameters:
      x - The row position to check.
      y - The column position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is a lake, false otherwise.

    • isValidPosition

      public boolean isValidPosition(int x, int y)
      Checks if a given position is within the board's boundaries.
      Parameters:
      x - The row position.
      y - The column position.
      Returns:
      true if the position is within bounds, false otherwise.
